definition: to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: She learns to speak Latin by osmosis within three months.
sentences.chinese: 她废寝忘食地在三个月内学会了拉丁语。

sentences.english: Building model trains is his consuming passion.
sentences.chinese: 制作模型火车是他废寝忘食的爱好。

sentences.english: In the company, he is called workaholic He spends most of his time working, and often forgets to have meals or to go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 他把大部分时间都用于工作，为工作他常常废寝忘食。

sentences.english: She learns to speak Lation by osmosis within three months.
sentences.chinese: 她废寝忘食三个月学会了拉丁语。

sentences.english: Fuller clock drilling, and finally out of a training extraordinary boy.
sentences.chinese: 恒景废寝忘食苦练，终于练出了一身非凡的武艺。

definition: see 廢寢忘食|废寝忘食[fei4 qin3 wang4 shi2]
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
to stay up through the night (idiom)
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
to be sleepless all night
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
day and night/round-the-clock
selflessness/altruism
